CEO & President of Bubble Motion

Tom has started, worked for and ran numerous high-tech companies. Prior to running Bubble Motion, Tom was GM of the Worldwide Telecom Business at BEA Systems, an infrastructure software company acquired by Oracle for $8.5B. Before BEA, Tom helped start five different companies. At his most recent startup, Bang Networks, another Sequoia Capital and Goldman Sachs backed networking software company, he helped build out the business development and salesforce organizations. Tomâ€™s other startups ranged from an ecommerce-focused systems integrator to a high-end audio manufacturer. He also worked as an economic policy consultant to The White House, where he drafted the U.S. High-Tech and Telecommunications Economic Stimulus Policy for building out nationwide ubiquitous broadband access. Prior to Tomâ€™s professional career, he was a boxer and won the Bronze Medal at the U.S. National Championships.
